content: tipping the hat to a poem by paul verlaine mock cables undulate like row of hedges off toward the horizon this simple rectangular design is simple and comforting to knit streamlined for charity knitting this easily adaptable design can be worn as a shawl or generous scarf fully charted and written instructions are easy to adapt for sizing adjustments now also available in a web version 1 dimensions length 52 / 132 cm width approximately 14 / 35 5 cm unstretched ribbed fabric opens to about 16 / 40 cm when worn yarn if knitting for charity donation take care to use a yarn that will easily tolerate machine washing and drying photos show finished shawl after one cycle in the washer and dryer in a public laundromat on medium heat sample used 4 skeins of plymouth encore colorspun worsted colorway 7765 turquoise errata in the first version of the pattern the body repeat should read as follows work row 1-4 until piece measures **46 / 117 cm** downloading now should give you the updated file web version is also correct 1 https //sway office com/cadorwzd5jhftbps ref=link
